poem:
**On the Headlines**

Shocked and thrilled,
a dance of politics
in swing-state air,
Kamala chooses,
Trump's delight  
etches the morning.

August, a mosaic  
of alliances,
charms bend like light  
on pages,  
while newsprint  
holds its breath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "US election live: Harris and Walz on swing-state charm offensive; Trump hints at Harris debate news ‘fairly soon’ 2.57pm BST Here is video of Donald Trump describing his shock at Kamala Harris’s vice-president pick, Tim Walz: "I can't believe it. ... I could not be more thrilled."— Donald Trump is very happy that Kamala Harris chose Tim Walz as her VP pick pic.twitter.com/tMUxSekadZ— The Recount (@therecount) August 7, 2024 Speaking to Fox News, Trump said". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
